title: Simulation-Based Expert Competency Enhancement Program: Comparing Remote and In-Person Training

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level foundational knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: A blended simulation training approach combining remote (RF-SBT) and face-to-face (LF-SBT) methods in smartphone-based constrained technology environments, focusing on eliciting learners' psychosocial responses and cognitive engagement

learning_goals: Learners achieve at least 80% in professional accountability (perception of responsibility) within the simulation environment.
Learners rate the applicability to real-world settings (perception of realism) at 75% or higher after remote/in-person simulation training.
Learners express at least 85% team belonging (perception of affiliation) through interactions with peers and instructors.
Learners perceive at least 70% cognitive effort (conscious mental exertion) when performing simulation tasks.

resources: Real-Time Video Conferencing Tool for Remote Training
Small-Scale Simulation Kit for In-Person Sessions
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
